definitions.text: a statute in draft before it becomes law
examples: they held a public hearing on the bill

definitions.text: an itemized statement of money owed for goods shipped or services rendered
examples: he paid his bill and left
send me an account of what I owe

definitions.text: a piece of paper money (especially one issued by a central bank)
examples: he peeled off five one-thousand-zloty notes

definitions.text: the entertainment offered at a public presentation
an advertisement (usually printed on a page or in a leaflet) intended for wide distribution
examples: he mailed the circular to all subscribers

definitions.text: a sign posted in a public place as an advertisement
examples: a poster advertised the coming attractions

definitions.text: a list of particulars (as a playbill or bill of fare)
a long-handled saw with a curved blade
examples: he used a bill to prune branches off of the tree

definitions.text: a brim that projects to the front to shade the eyes
examples: he pulled down the bill of his cap and trudged ahead

definitions.text: horny projecting mouth of a bird

examples: Will I get charged for this service?
We were billed for 4 nights in the hotel, although we stayed only 3 nights

definitions.text: advertise especially by posters or placards
examples: He was billed as the greatest tenor since Caruso
